definition: king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
Mu Kung or Tung Wang Kung, God of the Immortals (Taoism)

sentences.english: Later, she often granted the pie to the ministers of the palace as a reward.
sentences.chinese: 以后，她就经常把茯苓饼赏给那些王公大臣。

sentences.english: Having a rest in the bamboo forest behind Village Wang Gong Keng.
sentences.chinese: 王公坑村背竹林下休息一会。

sentences.english: From the large to small streets and so, even to entertain.
sentences.chinese: 从王公大宅到街巷小户都如是，就连待客也如此。

sentences.english: It has created palaces, but it was not so easy to create noblemen and kings.
sentences.chinese: 宫殿可以建造，但培养王公贵族却非易事。

sentences.english: The hour of new heroes has come, when the throne of the Grand Principality became empty.
sentences.chinese: 曾经光荣的英雄们和伟大的王公们都一去不返了。

sentences.english: There is a deaf and dumb Maharajah staying on the top floor.
sentences.chinese: 有一个聋哑王公住在最高层。

sentences.english: The Moon is Aquarius or Pisces makes the Native to be disliked by Princes, Grandees and the upper ten.
sentences.chinese: 月亮落在水瓶或者双鱼，命主会被王公贵族所讨厌。

sentences.english: In those times wrestling was a favourite sport even in the courts of princes.
sentences.chinese: 那时候连王公的宫廷里也盛行摔跤这种游戏。

sentences.english: He would keep open house and entertain like a prince.
sentences.chinese: 他要大宴宾客，来者不拒，像王公贵族一样。

sentences.english: What money he could lay his hands on, he spent like an Indian rajah .
sentences.chinese: 凡是能到他手里的钱，他花起来像个王公贵族。

definition: imperial clan/member of the imperial clan/clansman/ancestral shrine
high-ranking officials in the court of a Chinese emperor
member of a monarch's inner ministerial circle (old)
the emperor relatives (idiom); person with powerful connections
